instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
HI there,
I have 820-3462 that doesn't really sleep.

It responds to the LID being shut by disabling backlight, but the board is still in an ?S0 state, all S0 rails are still there including Vcore.
Has anyone ever had that? what could cause this?

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
SMC_LID really goes to 0V?
Check what happens with PM_SLP_S3_L at same time.

BTW, any history available?

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
yes, sms_lid goes completely to. 0.001V
PM_SLP_S3_L stays at 3.34V

no liquid damage visible under scope, no evidence of drop damage to the casing

also, results don't change when booted off of known good USB osx

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
Check PCIE_WAKE_L.
Board stays off when shut it down from OSX?

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
PCIE_WAKE_L is 3.34V with the LID closed
the board does indeed stay off when I shut it down from within OSX

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
USB activity present when close the lid?

Try PRAM reset 2-3 times...

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
Resetting PRAM 3 times has not made a difference.
And yes, USB activity when lid is closed, I have a USB drive with LED that shows it is being read.

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
If backlight goes off, means SMC informs PCH about lid state.
This could be PCH issue, but try full known good working BIOS, just for test.

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
First thing suspect is a software issue. Remove SSD and boot from known good USB drive.
After that disconnect all devices, including keyboard/trackpad/LCD etc. Yes fans will run at full will be slow, but see if it sleeps then.
Any other history? Liquid? Especially SMC area.

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message:
hey Duke, alles goed?

it's good you reminded me about disconnecting devices. i tried a new flex cable after that, just because one is laying around here on the desk.
Jesus Christ, that was the cause?
It's now sleeping normally...
Thanks 2infos for all fast replies and thanks Duke for your common sense

threads.title: 820-3462 sleepless
threads.message: SLP S3 and S4 go to the IO board so that can very well mess with sleep states.
